revised_title: Behavioral Patterns and Responses of the Sea Anemone Calliactis parasitica to Shells of the Hermit Crab Pagurus bernhardus
tldr: The study examines the five-stage behavior pattern of the sea anemone Calliactis parasitica when transferring to shells of the hermit crab Pagurus bernhardus. The clinging response of the anemone to shells is found to depend on a general molluscan shell-factor, and the anemone establishes the association without the crab's assistance. The research provides insights into the factors involved in the anemone's response to a shell and the movements required for successful settlement.
